intro: Apodanthera laciniosa, commonly known as the lacey apodanthera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apodanthaceae, which includes parasitic plants. The plant is characterized by its unique, intricate floral structures and reduced leaves. It typically grows in humid, tropical environments and relies on specific host plants for nutrients. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies in plant morphology and parasitism.
